definition: to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: The doubters, in fact, have already come forward.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，持懷疑觀點的人已經出面放話了。

sentences.english: It's easy for DiCaprio's character to make this claim.
sentences.chinese: 迪卡普里奧的角色能這樣放話到不困難。

sentences.english: He even promised to veto a stopgap measure.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至還放話要否決任何權益之計。

definition: to fire a gun/to substitute for sb in sitting an examination
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
Cross-Strait Service Trade Agreement/abbr. for 兩岸服務貿易協議|两岸服务贸易协议[Liang3 an4 Fu2 wu4 Mao4 yi4 Xie2 yi4]
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to force someone to do something
